citation.article-title: DNA relatedness among the pathovars of Pseudomonas syringae and description of Pseudomonas tremae sp. nov. and Pseudomonas cannabina sp. nov. (ex Sutic and Dowson 1959).

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas cannabina sp. nov.
Pseudomonas cannabina (can.na'bi.na. L. fem. adj. cannabina pertaining to Cannabis, the generic name of the host plant, Cannabis sativa L.)
Gram-negative rods that are 1.1-3.0 μm wide x 3.0-4.0 μm long and motile by means of one to four polar flagella.
Colonies have a grey colour and are slightly convex on YPGA.
Produces a fluorescent pigment on King B medium.
Results of LOPAT tests are +, -, -, - and + (Lelliott et al., 1966).
No hydrolysis of aesculin or starch.
Arginine test (Thornley), indole production and gelatin liquefaction are negative.

Assimilates D-glucose, D-fructose, Dgalactose, D-mannose, D-ribose, glycerol, D-saccharate, mucate, citrate, D-gluconate, L-histidine, L-aspartate, L-glutamate, L-proline, L-alanine and L-serine and does not assimilate the other 83 carbon sources of the Biotype 100 strips (bioMirieux).
The DNA G+C content is 60.2 mol%.
In nature, pathogenic on Cannabis sativa L. and by inoculation on Phaseolus vulgaris L.
